publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-445 Carolyn Leckie: Use of Language by the Executive on Anti-social Behaviour-That the Parliament is appalled at the use of stigmatising and ill-informed language in recent debates; is further appalled at the Scottish Executive's use of the word "plague" in a press release in reference to the anti-social behaviour debate; recognises that those referred to as persistent young offenders are overwhelmingly the most vulnerable, disadvantaged and sometimes abused section of the population, and calls on the Executive to define who the "plague" is, explain its use of the word, withdraw the comments and apologise unreservedly. Supported by: Frances Curran*
